did.abstract: This volume contains accounts of Peale's museum, which was housed in Philosophical Hall. The cover reads: "Philosophical Hall Accounts." Only a few accounts are itemized, for example, "for Musick" and "for Hand bills." A few receipts for payment of taxes are included, with some sketches of animals and scenes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Mrs. Coleman Mills ($300.00) and accessioned, 03/22/1960 (1960 654ms).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This collection is also available on microfilm (Film 240). The papers of C. W. Peale and his family have been reproduced almost in their entirety in microfiche form (Lillian B. Miller, ed. "Collected papers of Charles Willson Peale and his family." Kraus Microfilm, 1980).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The main body of the Peale Collection is described briefly in American Philosophical Society "Year Book" 1945:74-77.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Willson Peale was an artist and naturalist. His museum was the first to be scientifically organized and open to the American public on a regular basis.

odd.head: Early American History Not
odd.p: The Charles Wilson Account book for 1785-1795 contains an assortment of business transcations of C.W. Peale during this period, most of which deal with his museum. In addition to the business accounts – which are sparse but may contain noteworthy information on Peale’s personal interests – this volume contains a series of watercolors and pencil sketches, likely done by Peale. They are relatively crude sketches of a dog, houses, profiles of unknown individuals, flowers, and other items.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.
